ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2-3 hours
6 hours.
8 hours
10 hours
6 hours
3 hours per week
15+ hours
10 hours per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This class is great overall, my only suggestion is to shorten the time for each class session and maybe meet twice a week.

A very good class, but the homework assignments are very lengthy. This also should be turned into a full semester class, because it felt like everything was crunched into the last few weeks of school and caused us even to have class during reading week, which shouldn't be the case.
This is an excellent course that is well worthy taking.Maria is very clear about what she is teaching and explain the content very clearly and in a very organized way.
The course is very helpful in providing basic quantitative knowledge.
Amazing slides and the homework is very helpful to understanding the material
Strengths: the instructor is very nice and her slides are very goodWeaknesses: It took many, many hours to complete the homework (too detailed, too many calculations...)
really good.. Very comprehensive. A must take course for any public health student.
I really enjoyed this class. I wish it was a full semester though and covered more topics in depth
Slides were comprehensive and detailed (however they were less clear/comprehensive as the slides for BIS 632)BIS 630 and BIS 632 were the best taught biostatistics courses I have taken.

This is an excellent course. It would have been better to have a full semester course and go into more depth. The final exam was too time limited given the questions. It felt like there was more emphasis on being tested on speed of answering the questions versus content.
detailed, not enough time

This is a very good course. Its main strengths are that it covers the major concepts and applications of applied survival analysis and that the lecture notes are regularly very good; while a weakness is that some type of questions in the assignments are different from the exams, and sometimes from those in the slides too. Therefore, it can improved by doing the assignments and lecture notes even more homogeneous with the exams.
super practical, very nice job
If only the instructor could stop reading the lecture notes
it's vey helpful and well-organized, I hope we could have more in-class time to learn something in detail.
Really good course materials and lectures.
very good!
Homework included too many problems that were solved by hand. Didn't really seem to realistically represent how these problems would be solved in the work setting where SAS would probably be used.

strengths: This course is an essential component of the biostatistics curricula at YSPH and to my knowledge, the most accessible and in depth look at the cox proportional hazards modelweaknesses: This should be a full-semester course

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is very nice and helpful. Highly recommend her for every student who is interested in biostatistics.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  A wonderful teacher, who truly understands the material and can convey that knowledge effectively to students. She certainly should teach more biostats courses, since she can actually teach this material.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Mario is a excellent instructor, providing one of the best slides.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a excellent teacher.1. The lecture notes is so well organized and prepared.2. She explained the contents very clearly and in detail.3. She replies students' questions quickly and patiently!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is great. When MPH students want some statistical exposure, her classes are always the right choice.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is very responsible and helpful. Her lecture notes are extremely organized and useful.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  YOU ARE GREAT!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very knowledgeable, very kind instructor!

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is the best teacher in the biostats department, and the only one who can teach well from a practical perspective. Her explanations makes sense. She is a bio-statistician who understands epidemiology concepts.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria did a great job teaching the class. Her lecture notes were very informative and really helped with learning the subject
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is best biostatistics instructor I have had.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very good instructor. Excellent lecture notes that are a good resource for the future.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent lecture slides
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is very good for providing explanations in class, and is always open to questions.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  very nice job
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Ways of Improving:make the course more intersting
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Best biostatistics instructor I have had at Yale. Wish she could teach everything!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She's a great teacher. A very good lecturer with great slides. She's one of the top 3 in my list of best instructors in our program.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  The most skillful lecturer I have ever met at Yale. I enjoyed her class so much.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Really good course materials and lectures.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  very good!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Great instructor; clear slides and receptive to students
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Incredibly patient, organized, thoughtful and innovative in the classroom. She is legitimately one of the brightest and motivated young professors at YSPH.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Great guy.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Great TA, very helpful in terms of answering questions
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  A wonderful TA and very responsive and patient with questions.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  very responsive and helpful
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe is great, very patient and thorough.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  I did not attend the TA session, but Kyaw always give timely feedback of homework questions.

Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Kyaw Sint did a fantastic job. I found him extremely knowledgeable, always available to help even outside his office hours, and very friendly and professional. Thank you very much :)
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Very knowledgeable, very kind TA!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  He always responded to emails promptly and graded farely
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe did a great job TAing the class. He proved adequate feed back in a timely manner
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  The TA was helpful and very responsive with questions via email.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Very responsive to any questions by email.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Good TA
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  He is a very good TA. He was supportive all the time, either in office hours or by email.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  good job
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  thanks.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Responsible
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  He helped us a lot. Really nice.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  very good!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  A bit frazzled at times, but overall nice.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe was fantastic; always available and always helpful!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. The instructor is very good and class powerpoint materials are very comprehensive, easy to use them to prepare for exams and for further study.
Very informative class, although quite a lot of work packed into too short a time.
Recommend to student who want to learn basics of survival analysis.
Yes, I would. The course is excellent.
Great course if you are looking to enhance your SAS/ biostats skills!
I would recommend this course to students who like biostatistics.
A must have course....Instructor is awesome
Basic introduction to survival analysis. I would recommend this course to no biostats students. I do not think it was hard/intense enough for biostats students
Yes I would recommend this course, because it us well taught and the slides were great.
A good introduction to survival analysis with practical assignments and excellent teaching.
Good course

I would recommend it. It is a really good course for those interested in learning advance intermediate/advanced methods in biostatistics. It provides a great overview of the uses of survival analysis.
I would recommand this course. Super applied
yes
Definitely recommend it.
Really good course materials and lectures. Course contents are with much density. But worth taking it.
yes, good class
Good , would recommend
